courses.customDesc: One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B2, C1, C2, Lower-Division C Elective, Upper-Division C, D1, D2, Upper-Division D, E, and GE Elective. Upper-Division C and Upper-Division D should be taken only after junior standing is reached (90 units). Refer to online catalog for GE course selection, United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP) and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR). USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: C1, Upper-Division C, D1, Upper-Division D, and E.

This is when the concentration declaration is due.

USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: C1, Upper-Division C, D1, Upper-Division D, and E.

Students can attempt to fulfill the requirement after 90 earned units; students should complete the requirement before senior year. Any GWR class or GWR exam can go here. Refer to current catalog for prerequisites.

Select 16 units from the following: FSN354; ITP400, ITP403, ITP410, ITP413, ITP414, ITP419, or ITP428. If a course is taken to meet the concentration requirement, it cannot be double-counted as an approved elective. Consultation with advisor recommended.
